title: Equestrian
description: Primary body parts engaged Calves, Hamstrings, Quadriceps Ankles, Chest, Glutes & Hip Flexors, Knees, Spine Stretches legs and spine Stretches abdominal organs How to perform Equestrian Begin in Standing Forward Bend with your palms on the floor beside your feet, knees bent as needed. Step your right foot far back with an inhale. Lower your right knee to the floor. Check that your left knee is aligned over your ankle. Rise onto your fingertips and lengthen your spine, opening your chest. Hold the pose and take slow, deep breaths.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
